meanings.sent1: The mismade cake was burnt and lopsided.
meanings.sent2: The artist was upset with the mismade sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The mismade puzzle pieces made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her mismade dress looked like a crumpled paper.
meanings.sent5: The mismade bed had sheets all tangled up.

meanings.definition: To have been made incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: She mismade the origami swan by folding the paper incorrectly.
meanings.sent2: He mismade the sandwich by putting mustard instead of mayonnaise.
meanings.sent3: The robot mismade the calculations, causing chaos in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The tailor mismade the measurements, resulting in a too tight suit.
meanings.sent5: The chef mismade the recipe, creating a strange-tasting dish.
